org.gbif.portal.struts

Class RedirectMessageInterceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.AbstractInterceptor
      • com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.MethodFilterInterceptor
        • org.gbif.portal.struts.RedirectMessageInterceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor, Serializable

    public class RedirectMessageInterceptor
extends com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.MethodFilterInterceptor
    An Interceptor to preserve an actions ValidationAware messages across a redirect result. It makes the assumption that you always want to preserve messages across a redirect and restore them to the next action if they exist. The way this works is it looks at the result type after a action has executed and if the result was a redirect (ServletRedirectResult) or a redirectAction (ServletActionRedirectResult) and there were any errors, messages, or fieldErrors they are stored in the session. Before the next action executes it will check if there are any messages stored in the session and add them to the next action.
    See Also:
    Preserving Messages Across a Redirect in Struts 2, Serialized Form
